item.title: Magda add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "Magazines all too frequently lead to books and should be regarded by the prudent as the heavy petting of literature." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Magda add a quote by Simone Weil
item.description: "Imaginary evil is romantic and varied; real evil is gloomy, monotonous, barren, boring. Imaginary good is boring; real good is always new, marvelous, intoxicating." -- Simone Weil

item.title: Magda add a quote by William Hazlitt
item.description: "We are never so much disposed to quarrel with others as when we are dissatisfied with ourselves." -- William Hazlitt

item.title: Magda add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Learn from yesterday, live for today, look to tomorrow, rest this afternoon." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Magda add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "True love is not so much a matter of romance as it is a matter of anxious concern for the well-being of one's companion." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Magda add a quote by Sigrid Undset
item.description: "Do you know who 'twas that first knew our Lord had caused Himself to be born? 'Twas the cock; he saw the star, and so he said–all the beasts could talk Latin in those days; he cried: 'Christus natus est!' " He crowed these words so like a cock that Kristin fell to laughing heartily. And it did her good to laugh, for all the strange things Brother Edvin had just been saying had laid a burden of awe on her heart. The monk laughed himself: "Ay, and when the ox heard that, he began to low: 'Ubi, ubi, ubi.' "But the goat bleated, and said: 'Betlem, Betlem, Betlem.' "And the sheep so longed to see Our Lady and her Son that she baa-ed out at once: 'Eamus, eamus!' "And the new-born calf that lay in the straw, raised itself and stood upon its feet. 'Volo, volo, volo!' it said." -- Sigrid Undset

item.title: Magda add a quote by Ashleigh Brilliant
item.description: "Not being able to do everything is no excuse for not doing everything you can." -- Ashleigh Brilliant

item.title: Magda add a quote by Mother Theresa of Calcutta
item.description: "It is a poverty to decide that a child must die so that you may live as you wish." -- Mother Theresa of Calcutta

item.title: Magda add a quote by Donald Horban
item.description: "We don't need to increase our goods nearly as much as we need to scale down our wants. Not wanting something is as good as possessing it." -- Donald Horban

item.title: Magda add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one’s attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one’s own way." -- Viktor E. Frankl
